title: Espresso Tales
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: I myself would have loved to have been a Commissioner of the Northern Lighthouses, but I was never invited. That's the problem with Edinburgh: to be a member of anything really worthwhile and important – such as the Royal Company of Archers or the Northern Lighthouse Board (not to mention the Knights of the Thistle!) – one has to be invited. Why can one not apply?
